meaning: a) She is a dazzling brilliance.
commentary:
‘Sushamā परमा (paramā) मोदा (modā) modākāntir dyutischitih’ means ‘brightness/radiance (splendor) is known as Paramā, Sushamā or Kānti.

b) As an absolute power that supersedes even the energy of Goddess Lakshmi (ma), She is extolled as Paramā.

The very first stanza of Ramayana is-  Mā Nishada Pratistham Tvamagamahsāsvati Samā.

‘Mā’ has many meanings but here it refers to Goddess Lakshmi. As the energy that supersedes Lakshmi, She is Paramā.

Parama consists of two words पर+मा (para+mā) which means ‘that which is most supreme’.Paramā thus means that She is over and above all forms of prosperity.
